It’s a great game, and this sounds like the perfect time to pick it up, especially if you previously pirated it after the devs said they didn’t mind.
Read more
articles.title: Slay The Princess gets three new chapters and more when The Pristine Cut releases 24th October

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Resident Evil's awkward middle child, Resident Evil 3: Nemesis, is now available via GOG. It follows in the leaking, shambling footsteps of Residents Evil 1 and 2, which likewise oozed onto the platform in June and in August respectively.

 
Read more
articles.title: The original Resident Evil 3 is now available via GOG, following the arrivals of its predecessors

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I don't know why it's throwback racing game Christmas, but it is. Parking Garage Rally Circuit came out September 20th, Golden Lap is out tomorrow, Victory Heat Rally is out October 3rd, and today - today brings the Steam Early Access release of #Drive Rally, an unfortunately hashtagged arcade racer trying to recapture the "spirit of the 90s".

 
Read more
articles.title: #Drive Rally is an arcade racer with forgiving physics out in Early Access now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Metaphor: ReFantazio is either a high-fantasy Persona or a Shin Megami Tensei with cool fonts and a warm heart. Edwin dug its hybrid combat system, while James was moved by its mad libs monster design. It has an October 11th release date, but you don't have to wait until then to begin plotting it and you along these various axes. There's a demo you can play out now.

 
Read more
articles.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio, the high-fantasy RPG from Persona's designers, now has a playable demo

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The AssCreed faithful have waited a thousand years for a sequel set in feudal Japan, birthplace of ninjas and samurai. Woe unto ye dreamers of Ubisoft takes on Tenchu, for you must carry that candle for a little longer. Assassin's Creed Shadows has been delayed till next year. It was due to launch on 12th November 2024 - now, it will release on 14th February 2025.

 
Read more
articles.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows delayed to 2025 as Ubisoft try to recover from "softer than expected" Star Wars Outlaws launch

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Initially, Lorn’s Lure feels like an escape. A first-person spelunking sim, it takes place in a colossal, mournful extent of pipes and silos, ancient turbines and concrete cliffs, where emergency lighting and broken gantries form scrappy platforming routes into darkness. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Lorn's Lure is the anti yellow paint game, a joyful and maddening exploration of sunken megastructures

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Not technically an Indiescovery-type deal, this, as Edwin already called attention to breathless FPS Echo Point Nova back when the demo came out. The full game has just released, though, and as someone with such chronic Titanfall withdrawal that I’ll ingest anything with a decent wallrun, I’ve bought it, played it, and am here to tell you why it rocks.
Read more
articles.title: Titanfall and Tribes fans, don't miss skyfaring shooter Echo Point Nova

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
There is an absolute carkfest of a headline to be written here involving the words "head" "not" "enough" and "giving", but I am a journalist of grace and discretion, and will resist. Treyarch, Raven Software and Activision have popped up a note-to-players covering a range of improvements they're making to Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 in the aftermath of August's beta. Specifically, they're tweaking the damage from bullets to the cranium, while trying to ensure that bullets to the cranium don't "significantly affect the consistency of time to kill".
 Read more
articles.title: Black Ops 6's developers are trying to work out how quickly headshots should kill you

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
If you're a nerd of a certain age, I apologise - that headline has probably caused you to rupture something in the wizened meat of your lower back, or the swampy catacombs of your cerebellum. If you aren't, let me explain: Zachtronics are or were a US-based video game developer founded in 2000 by Zach Barth, who put the studio on ice in 2022 and now works at Coincidence Games, a "flexible business framework" involving many former Zachtronics devs. Zachtronics have thrown together all kinds of things - Infiniminer, a block-builder from 2009, is probably the single greatest individual influence on Minecraft, while Eliza is a tremendous visual novel about AI chatbots and labour politics. But if there's a type of game they're known for, it's engineering puzzles and factory games.
 
Read more
articles.title: Would you play a Warhammer 40K factory game? Because Zachtronics almost made one

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Hey, remember Lost In Random? I reviewed it way back when and thought its Burtonesque setting and story were top notch, but it felt a bit reliant on samey fights. Moonhood Studios, founded by the creators of LIR, just announced The Midnight Walk at last night's PlayStation State Of Play showcase. And it looks to continue their appreciation of the dark and the strange. Case in point: it's a first-person adventure where you play as The Burnt One, who must steer a hideous pot creature through a twisted universe.
Read more
articles.title: The Midnight Walk sees you take a hideous ceramic lad on a grim claymated stroll

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
When you stare into the PlayStation Showcase, it stares also into you. Open world samurai action game Ghost Of Tsushima is getting a follow-up called Ghost Of Yotei, developers Sucker Punch have announced (or Ghost Of Yōtei, to include the technically-correct-but-annoying-to-reproduce-on-UK-keyboards diacritic that I will hereby drop to secure our sanity). It looks very picturesque and, like its predecessor, inspired by the Kurosawa showdowns of old. You can see for yourself in the trailer that acted as the finale of Sony's marketing show.
Read more
articles.title: Ghost Of Yotei announced as a samurai sequel to Ghost Of Tsushima

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Last year we reported horror game Alan Wake 2 would be getting a couple of expansions. We've already had one of these in the form of Night Springs. And Edwin noted that the other would probably be a crossover with Remedy's other big game, Control, featuring secret government agency, the Federal Bureau of Control. He was right, judging by the trailer shown at yesterday's PlayStation Showcase. 
The Lake House DLC is due out in October, and does indeed feature a facility run by the shady organisation whose job it is to keep powerful "altered items" from running amok. But it looks like somebody let a messed-up oil painting out of its cage.
Read more
articles.title: Alan Wake 2's next expansion is about a Control agent investigating a spooky painting - and it's out next month

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
We don’t usually cover Kickstarter projects here at chez Shotgun. Horace got burnt by a dodgy coffee maker once, had to regrow a few limbs, it’s a whole thing, the bear doesn’t like talking about it, etc. Anyway, rules are like Horace’s arms: they’re meant to be stretched, and also made of bear. MÖRK BORG Heresy Supreme is a grotty cheese dream of a 2D action game based on the popular tabletop RPG MÖRK BORG - a book so nice to just have on your shelf that I’m not even mad I accidentally bought a copy in Swedish. It’s fine. Makes it more metal.
Read more
articles.title: Legendary black metal TTRPG MÖRK BORG is getting a brutal, nightmarish side scroller

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Something magical occurred to me this morning: fit-flaying RPG Monster Hunter Wilds will be the first time I get to play a Monster Hunter game while also being a cat dad. It’s going to great! “What’s that, eh?!” I’ll say, pointing to a Doshaguma in a manner that might foolishly suggest I expect her to give a damn. “Mraow”, she’ll reply, knock over my coffee, then go back to sleep. “It’s you!” I’ll exclaim, pointing to the Palico I’ve spent six hours making look just like her. “That looks nothing like me, you odorous lummox,” she’ll insinuate with a cocked eyebrow, then go shout at an ant for a bit.
Ah well, at least I have videogames - this one is out on the 28th of Febwar, 2025. Here’s a trailer from last night’s Sony-me-doo:
Read more
articles.title: Monster Hunter Wilds releases 28th Feb 2025, which gives modders enough time to silence the uncanny talking Palicos

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
A week ago, while belabouring the nuances of Arco, I expressed a wish to play more bullet hell games with time freeze mechanics, the better to savour the intricacy of their projectile patterning. Now here's Moon Watch, a Vampire Survivors-ish pixelart shooter in which you have a watch that stops time when you stand still. Snug within that frozen instant, you're free to laugh in the gurning faces of the living dead while you idly choose and aim garlic grenades, stake launchers and bouncy ice comets.
Read more
articles.title: Try the demo for top-down undead slayer Moon Watch, in which time is movement and movement is garlic grenades

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Dead By Daylight developers Behaviour Interactive have announced that they're acquiring Red Hook, the creators of Darkest Dungeon. This is the same Behaviour Interactive who recently laid off a bunch of people, cancelled a game and closed a studio, Midwinter Entertainment, after bagging themselves a bunch of developers (the others are SockMonkey, Codeglue and Fly Studio) over the past two years. Darkest Dungeon is a horror game like DBD, so I guess the acquisition chimes from that perspective. All the same, my snap judgement is "yikes".

 
Read more
articles.title: Dead By Daylight developers Behaviour acquire Darkest Dungeon developers Red Hook

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
I don’t like to brag, but it turns out that running a museum is actually well easy. Within an hour of sitting down to play Two Point Museum at Gamescom last month, I was running a modest monthly profit, educating the masses about one-fifth of a dinosaur skeleton, and most importantly, had not ordered a single staff member to their death.
Read more
articles.title: Two Point Museum is all about turning expeditions into exhibitions, provided your staff survive

articles.author: Liam Richardson
articles.description:
Like a samurai poised patiently for an opening in their opponent’s defences, Shogun Showdown understands that focus and finesse are the means to delivering an impactful blow. This rare roguelike distils the genre down to its purest components, all in favour of amplifying its dizzying combat that plays gracefully with the concepts of positioning and patience. Highly refined, stylish and complex, Shogun Showdown is a delight.
Read more
articles.title: Shogun Showdown review: an exceptional roguelike that hits different

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
These apparitions and portents, Crystal Dynamics - what game are you playing now? It turns out the game they are playing is: a remaster of amazeballs vampire odyssey Legacy Of Kain: Soul Reaver, together with its less amazing but sturdy sequel. Said remaster project was rumoured earlier this year, when Sarafan scouts caught sight of a telltale plaque at San Diego Comic-Con. Consider that rumour strongly trending towards the status of a Real Thing, because Sony are in the habit of publishing Real Things, and they've just (accidentally, I guess) popped a bunch of screens and a trailer with a release date - 10th December 2024 - on the PlayStation website. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Soul Reaver remaster release date, screens and trailer leak via PlayStation and it all looks far too shiny

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Look out, it's Spiders. It's fun to write about Spiders, because you get to frighten people for a moment, before they realise you're talking about the game development studio, Spiders. They have just released GreedFall 2: The Dying Land into early access. For those who don't remember the first GreedFall, it was a colonial-styled RPG about landing on the magical shores of another continent and getting into scrapes with monsters and frontiersfolk. This time the story is furthering the fantasy Columbian exchange by putting you in the role of a native who's been uprooted against their will and taken to the "old world". The game's release comes against a backdrop of dissatisfaction in the studio. But workers have gained some concessions in talks. 
Read more
articles.title: Spiders release fantasy RPG GreedFall 2 in early access, as its frustrated workers are offered concessions

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
For years, a dangerous and charismatic game has evaded the grasp of many designers. Some say it doesn't exist, that no publisher would ever back it. I'm talking about the one city block RPG that Warren Spector has often mentioned. Sure, we've seen a few usual suspects already - Deus Ex Mankind Divided, Disco Elysium, even Else: Heart.Break - they all grimace in the line-up but nothing ever sticks. Now, out of the gloom of indie development, comes another perp ready to have his mugshot taken. Shadows Of Doubt is an open world detective sim that comes perilously close to being our guy. Its clothes, stature, gait, and fingerprints match the description of what Spector often describes. And yet, if you tilt your head, something is just a little off. The game isn't confined to one block. It's not an RPG precisely. And its simulation has plenty of bugs, jank, and unintentional comedy. But after all this time, in the absence of a smoking gun, shouldn't we just put this guy in the slammer and call the case closed? I say yes, let's. Officers! Arrest this game, it's brilliant. 
Read more
articles.title: Shadows Of Doubt review: a buggy yet brilliant detective sim of grand ambition

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
The in thing when it comes to dinosaur conversations now is this: "Yeah but did you know that they weren't all like, lizardy, but covered in feathers". You might want to chuck in that chickens are basically dinosaurs, because their feet have a "Triassic Flange", a (made-up) term that will make you sound authoritative. If you really want to showcase your knowledge, though, you may want to mention that dinosaurs may have actually fought with large swords lodged between their teeth. Dinoblade demonstrates this! And no, they haven't discovered swords alongside dinosaur fossils yet because palaeontologists have been unlucky thus far. "Soon", you tell them.
Read more
articles.title: Dinoblade has you duke it out as dinos with buster swords clamped between your gnashers

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
We liked Jusant, Don't Nod's clamber-upper masterpiece, and we also liked Banishers, their colonial ghost-busting action-adventure, but it seems that not enough people did. The company have posted a profit warning, reflecting an 11% decline in operating revenue for the first half of 2024. They've also "paused" two unannounced games in development, and altered other unannounced games to be more appealing to a "wider audience". Beyond that, they're considering "all possible options regarding our roadmap", which sounds just a touch ominous.  
 
Read more
articles.title: Don't Nod "pause" two game projects and "refocus" others following Jusant and Banishers sales disappointment

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I'm not someone who's ever been on board with the "Can You Pet The Dog?" craze that swept and/or still sweeps video games. As a heartless individual, I am more concerned with whatever the dog's capable of: general savagery, a howl that replenishes my HP bar, letting me climb atop its glorious mane as it strides across the barren wastes. If it's none of these things, I would much rather have a shiny turret on spindly steel legs skitter besides me.
Nomada Studios have, incredibly, thrust their hands into my chest cavity and given me a blood-pumping mechanism. Having spent some time with upcoming action-platformer Neva (the game) and Neva (the dog from the game), I have to admit: I did enjoy petting Neva (the dog).
Read more
articles.title: Alright fine, Neva makes me want to pet the dog

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
This one’s a very simple build at the moment, but neat enough that I wanted to shout it out. Near Mint is a roguelike deckbuilder where you advance through a tower fighting slightly stronger iterations of the exact same skeleton. Ok, nothing too captivating so far. The twist comes from the cards: someone’s left them in their Oodie pouch, spilt BBQ sauce down it, then stuck it in the wash before taking the deck out. Now, all the cards have split apart into three pieces. It’s name-your-own-price on Itch here, and it’ll only take you a couple minutes to get acquainted, but I’ll explain the gist below. Gist is a good word. Satisfying to say. Gist.
Read more
articles.title: Near Mint is Slay The Spire but you’ve accidentally left your cards in the washing machine

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
While I’ve been known to enjoy a few of them in my time, I tend to view a lot of more mundane simulator games in the same way I view sports games: Looks fine, but I could do this stuff in real life, were I inclined and also social and also vaguely limber instead of owning a spine with roughly the flexibility of a rib n’ saucy Nik Nak.
Read more
articles.title: Buddy, if you’re only buying two lousy packs you can leave my TCG Card Shop Simulator store immediately

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Ever since Crimson Desert dropped that audacious trailer at Gamescom 2023, I’ve yearned to soak in its medieval Just Cause 2 vibes. It’s hard not to be moved by the exaggerated kineticism of it all – the magic-enhanced swordfights, the jumping off cliffs and turning into a flying shadow monster, the ability to drift horses. Yes. Yes!
I’m therefore somewhat unnerved to report that my enthusiasm has been tempered significantly by actually playing it. I’ve since used all the straws I’ve clutched at to spell out "It’s just a demo" on my floor, but the fear remains that Crimson Desert’s fantastical open-world exploration is going to be interrupted by regular bouts of twangy, unwieldy, unsatisfying combat.
Read more
articles.title: Crimson Desert, don’t let your slippery combat break my heart

articles.author: Caelyn Ellis
articles.description:
When playing a new Soulslike, there’s an element of translation involved while you figure out the language of the game. What are the upgrade materials called? What’s the equivalent of poison? What are experience points and checkpoints called, although you’re going to call them souls and bonfires anyway? I’ve done this many, many times, but on this occasion there was a surprising twist, one which would have notorious pearl-clutching racist HP Lovecraft spinning in his grave. Enotria: The Last Song’s arcane Soulslike language is actually just Italian.
Read more
articles.title: Enotria: The Last Song review: a straightforward, sunny Soulslike

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed is a remaster of Disney Epic Mickey, a cult classic 3D platformer first released a decade ago on the Wii. In the original you controlled the titular Mickey Mouse who, armed with a magical paintbrush (wieldable by waving the Wiimote about), could paint or rub out surfaces to solve puzzles. It was the work of Junction Studios led by Warren Spector, best known for being The Deus Ex Guy. No, sadly Mickey could not nano-augment his brush for better target acquisition, nor project laser-guided anti-tank rockets from his podgy white mitts.
And no, Rebrushed doesn't let him do anything of these either. Clearly a missed opportunity. But is it better nonetheless? With an updated look, some added secrets, more moves for Mickey, and controller/M&K support, I'd say longtime Mickey heads will adore this nostalgia trip. For total newcomers like me, I'd say it's a platformer that's certainly charming and clever and wonderfully experimental, but a bit flat in places too.
Read more
articles.title: Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed review: a faithful remaster of a paint-splashing platformer

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Valve are likely up to something hardware-related again, report NotebookCheck. Their next chunk of plastic and wires – following the Valve Index, Steam Deck and Steam Deck OLED – could swap PC gaming’s favoured x86 architecture for ARM, the type of processor favoured by the Nintendo Switch, Macs, and mobile phones.
Read more
articles.title: Valve’s ARM64 game testing points towards new Steam hardware, if vaguely

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Shirley Curry, aka the "Skyrim Grandma", is no longer posting gaming videos, she's told her viewers. An upcoming eye surgery is going to leave her recovering for some weeks and (more importantly to her) she is simply tired of playing games for an audience. 
"It isn't fun anymore," she says in a video. "I'm tired of it. I'm bored with it, bored to death with it. So I am making the decision now - totally, finally - I am not going to be making any more gaming videos and uploading them."
Read more
articles.title: The 88-year-old "Skyrim Grandma" isn't doing any more gaming videos (but will keep you updated on a quilt she's making)

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Spoilers throughout. TLDR: fun, generous, beautiful animation and cinematography. Worked mostly fine on my PC. I would not have given it the best narrative award if it were up against Gran Turismo 7. 
Writing of the frigid framing of Clockwork Orange’s atrocities, the film critic Pauline Kael asked: “is there anything sadder - and ultimately more repellent - than a clean-minded pornographer?” The lavishly directed and animated universe of God Of War Ragnarok is far from repellent, but it also feels spiritually squeegeed; a world of pulpy violence so chirpy and chaste as to strain belief that the scars that haunt its reformed anti-hero could have ever been inflicted there.
 
Read more
articles.title: God Of War Ragnarok review: calm down now, I’ve known this wolf for ninety seconds

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Earlier in the month, we learned that Stray and Neon White publisher Annapurna Interactive’s entire staff resigned after a dispute with boss Megan Ellison. Reported by Bloomberg as a disagreement over attempts to "spin off the video-game division as an independent entity," the details were nonetheless somewhat scant. A  new report from Rebekah Valentine at IGN has since shed some more light on the walkout, which reportedly involved “disagreements over the direction of the Interactive division, chaotic departures, communication breakdowns, and a perceived lack of leadership transparency.” It’s a thorough account of some messy events I recommend reading in full, but here’s a brief rundown.
Read more
articles.title: Annapurna Interactive has "splintered into two groups, both of which are now working to pick up the pieces" says new report

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Raise your thumb if you’ve ever impaled it on a HeroQuest skeleton’s scythe. Country’s gone soft these days, I tell you. I’ve seen those new Heroquest skellies. You couldn’t injure yourself on those scythes if you tried. It’s polearm-ical correctness gone mad! Well, good news if you’re nostalgic for a simpler time, where tiny scythes could maim you for life, and binary digits came in lots of eight and not a binary digit more. RPG Beyond Shadowgate is a vastly-expanded, modernised sequel to the classic NES adventure, created by the original’s designers, and it just released last week.
Read more
articles.title: I didn’t play Shadowgate, but this skeleton reminds me of HeroQuest and that’s good enough for me

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
This week's Maw, quantified: one compound eye with nine hundred and two quicksilver facets. One and a half wings with the texture of freshly peeled orange. Fifty tentacles, proboscises or flagella, some slender as cheesewire, some thick as a conifer. Ten sets of amethyst dentures shared by ten thousand mouths. One utility coat of muscles. One bowler hat. And now, an accompanying inventory of this week's most eye-catching new PC games.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Hello reader who is also a reader, and welcome back to Booked For The Week - our regular Sunday chat with a selection of cool industry folks about books! Once again, the dastardly autumn breezes have blown my schedule all out of whack, so no cool industry person this week. Instead, here is a short excerpt from another weird story I starting writing, also containing poultry for some reason.
 Read more
articles.title: What's on your bookshelf?: why have you put pumpkin spice in my grandfather's ashes edition

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sundays are for eating Biscoff spread and rewatching Better Call Saul, again. Crunchy, ofc. Before that, let’s read some writing that I, Nic Reuben, personally found interesting about games (and game related things!)
 
Read more
articles.title: The Sunday Papers

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Homeworld 3 is condensing its release schedule for post-launch updates. Instead of free and paid content arriving into 2025, it will all - three free updates, and two paid DLCs - arrive together in a "one major update" in November.

 
Read more
articles.title: Homeworld 3's coming paid DLC and free updates will now all launch in November, instead of running into 2025

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
The Finals' fourth season approaches. It'll kick off on September 26th, with a new map, a new tutorial and the restoration of Cashout as the core ranked mode. There's a new trailer below, which is worth watching even if you don't play The Finals, says I.

 
Read more
articles.title: The Finals' fourth season kicks off next week with a new map, new tutorial and the return of ranked Cashout

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Grunn is a self-described "extremely normal gardening game", in which you tend to a garden, explore different realities, and try not to die. We've been excited to get our hands on its shears for a while, thanks in part to an excellent demo, and in part due to it being from Sokpop Collective member and Bernband developer Tom van den Boogaart.

Now it has a release date: October 4th.

 
Read more
articles.title: Sokpop's possibly haunted gardening game Grunn will launch next month

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Sad news, all. I'm currently being sued by Nintendo for making myself a nice soft boiled egg for breakfast on Tuesday, the bright yellow yolk of which was apparently too reminiscent of Pikachu’s ballsack. They’ll likely take everything I have, including my typing keyboard, so this is goodbye from me. With my last digital breath, I only wish to inspire a bit more joy in the world, so I’m demanding everyone in the comments give me cat updates whether or not they own a cat. Just make up some lore for the cat you don’t have and tell me about it. Here's what we're all clicking on this weekend.
Read more
articles.title: What are we all playing this weekend?

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
It's a pirate's life for me, and it's a pirate's life for Goro Majima, recurring eyepatched anti-hero of the used-to-be-called-Yakuza series. He's the star of the just-announced Like A Dragon: Pirate Yakuza In Hawaii, a game I can only applaud for the brazen straightforwardness of its title. Whatever Sega were drinking when they signed off on Metaphor: ReFantazio, they were not drinking when they signed off on this. They were definitely drinking something, though. Here's the reveal trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: Like A Dragon: Pirate Yakuza In Hawaii has been announced and is coming for you, Skull And Bones

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
God of War Ragnarök initially looks like it has little trouble with squeezing itself into a Steam Deck. Yet like a flask of mead laced with Odin’s raven piss, the seemingly crisp treat of Ragnarök’s handheld performance masks a nasty blend of technical troubles and what is, essentially, an always-online requirement by stealth.
Read more
articles.title: God of War Ragnarök on Steam Deck shows the best and worst of handheld PC-ing

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
“We have been sold this myth for a very long time that unions have to be for blue collar workers in an industrial setting in the early 1900s,” Autumn Mitchell tells me. “The very simple definition of a union is just you and your co-workers coming together and forming a collective body. You can do that anywhere.”
A QA tester with Zenimax currently on union leave, Mitchell joined the Communications Workers Of America (CWA) as a full-time organiser after she and her colleagues formed what was, at the time, the biggest union in videogames - ZeniMax Workers United. Now she helps the CWA do what they did for her and her colleagues at Zenimax: provide support, training, resources and guidance for workers in the videogame industry who have decided, for whatever reason, that they want to unionise.
Read more
articles.title: From Blizzard to Bethesda, game unions are sweeping the industry - here's how the CWA helps make them happen

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I'm reasonably sure Final Fantasy 16 isn't the longest Final Fantasy I've ever played, but it feels that way, for a multitude of reasons. The major one is that a lot of its quests exist to create distance between places and plot beats. They are overwritten errands such as bringing people lunch or fetching herbs or carrying letters - dessicated, MMO-ish fare, thrust into a moderately enjoyable action-RPG for the sake of incremental worldbuilding and scale.

 
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy 16 review: if it were half as big it'd be twice as good

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The post-apocalyptic wastelands of Rain World are stunning, brutal, and full of strange creatures that would like to eat your kittenish face. It's a landscape of wonder and pain, and it's about to get a little more wonderful and painful. The upcoming Watcher expansion, which adds new places to visit and a new type of slugcat to play as, will be coming out early next year, say the developers. There's a trailer to say so. Look at this slippery gastropodal feline, standing calmly in the rain, as if the torrential and lethal weight of the water will not crush that little fuzzy head. The gall!
Read more
articles.title: Rain World's new slugcat will explore icy wastes and desert sands as The Watcher DLC gets a release date

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Nástup webových písem znamenal pro design stránek zásadní změnu. Do té doby byli jejich autoři odkázáni na písma instalovaná v uživatelských systémech, kterých je málo a mezi jednotlivými platformami jsou zcela nekonzistentní.
articles.title: Písma na webu: webové písmo a typografické speciality

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Budeme se opět zabývat neuronovými sítěmi. Ukážeme si změnu topologie neuronové sítě provádějící regresi, ale například i použití takzvané matice záměn (confusion matrix). Nakonec neuronovou síť naučíme malou násobilku.
articles.title: Neuronové sítě v knihovně scikit-learn (2.část)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Více než čtyři milióny zákazníků ve více než stovce zemí. Na tahle čísla dosáhla služba Starlink v roce 2024. Také to ovšem znamená více než 10 tisíc družic na orbitě Země, z nichž většina je Muskova.
articles.title: Starlink má čtyři miliony uživatelů, nebezpečně ale roste také počet družic

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Eischmann)
articles.description: Za půl roku, který uběhl od posledního vydání GNOME, udělali vývojáři mnoho práce. Nové GNOME vám umožní zvolit si systémovou barvu. GNOME Shell lépe škáluje na malých rozlišeních. Nautilus převzal roli dialogu pro výběr souboru.
articles.title: GNOME 47: vlastní nastavení barev, lepší škálování a nové dialogy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Zmíníme se o skromných začátcích rozvoje zvukového subsystému. Tyto počítače se z kanceláří postupně rozšířily i do domácností a společně s vývojem her se i pro ně začaly vyrábět rozličné zvukové karty.
articles.title: Zvuky a hudba na platformě IBM PC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: ČD - Telematika)
articles.description: V dnešním díle se podíváme, jak čínská auta sledují obyvatele USA, prozkoumáme islamofobní obsah na britských WiFi sítích a na závěr se zaměříme na Necro trojan a Octo2 malware na platformě Android.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: čínská auta jako nástroj sledování v USA

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Projekt Tor, který vyvíjí nástroj pro ochranu soukromí a anonymity a Tails, přenosný operační systém, spojily své síly. Projekt Arch Linux oznámil přímou spolupráci s herní společností Valve.
articles.title: Arch Linux spolupracuje s Valve, spojení projektů Tor a Tails

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Týden v KDE jako téměř definitivní finiš závodu o Plasmu 6.2, AMD a Dell i Framework chtějí zlepšit běh FreeBSD na noteboocích, energetická efektivita Xeonů Granite Rapids otestována.
articles.title: Asynchronní vypínání v Linuxu 6.12 nebude, FreeBSD poběží lépe na noteboocích

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ve světě PC máme jediného výrobce CPU, který stojí za řeč a jediného výrobce GPU, který dominuje trhu velkých hráčských karet. Křečovitě se drží jediný správný OS, zatímco jediný správný browser si poklidně kraluje.
articles.title: Pokračující monopolizace světa PC: kdo přijde další?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Typografické schopnosti webových prohlížečů zaznamenaly v uplynulých letech velký pokrok. Dnešní prohlížeče už umí věci, které byly ještě celkem nedávno vyhrazeny specializovaným programům.
articles.title: Písma na webu: rodina je základ písma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Na moderních počítačích s podporou video formátu AV1 – což typicky znamená desktopová či integrovaná GPU posledních generací AMD, Nvidia i Intel – nově umí Steam využívat (de)kódování video streamu do AV1 ve službě Remote Play. Teoreticky by tak na takových strojích mohl uživatel zaznamenávat vyšší kvalitu videa při stejné přenosové rychlosti.
articles.title: Steam Remote Play přidává podporu AV1 a nahrávání do H.265 s GPU

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Sdružení CZ.NIC vydalo novou verzi mobilní Datovky (2.1.0). Toto vydání přináší celou řadu změn včetně vzhledu některých prvků. Dá se ale říci, že většina těchto změn je pro uživatele nepostřehnutelná. Díky těmto vylepšením by měla být nová Datovka rychlejší při používání. Datovka nyní využívá novou verzi Qt, protože společnost Google začala vynucovat API level 34.
articles.title: Nová verze Datovky přináší změny pod kapotou

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Cisco opouští bez náhrady trh LoRaWAN pro připojení zařízení IoT. Pro uživatele nemá připravený žádný záložní nebo migrační plán. Společnost Cisco opouští oblast LoRaWAN. U bran Cisco LoRaWAN není plánována žádná migrace, uvádí jasně Cisco.
articles.title: Cisco opouští technologii LoRaWAN a pro zákazníky nemá žádný další plán

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Orgány činné v trestním řízení z 12 zemí zatkly čtyři osoby spojené s gangem okolo ransomwaru LockBit, včetně vývojáře a správce jejich zabezpečeného hostingu. Austrálie, Spojené království a Spojené státy dnes rovněž odhalily sankce proti osobě, kterou britské úřady považuje za aktivního člena skupiny LockBit napojeného na Evil Corp.
articles.title: Policie zatkla čtyři podezřelé spojené s ransomwarem LockBit

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po patnácti letech boje za bezpečnější a přístupnější web ukončila svou činnost nadace World Wide Web Foundation. Sir Tim Berners-Lee, vynálezce World Wide Webu, a Rosemary Leithová vysvětlují, že poslání organizace bylo do jisté míry splněno a je třeba vést nové bitvy.
articles.title: Nadace World Wide Web ukončuje po patnácti letech svou činnost

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Zranitelnost s označením CVE-2024–45519 se nachází v e-mailovém serveru Zimbra, který používají především středně velké a velké organizace. Pokud správce ručně změní výchozí nastavení a povolí službu postjournal, mohou útočníci spustit příkazy odesláním škodlivě vytvořených e-mailů na adresu hostovanou na serveru.
articles.title: Poštovní server Zimbra má vážnou zranitelnost umožňující spuštění cizího kódu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: OpenVPN je kompletní implementace VPN v uživatelském prostoru. Tento přístup má velkou výhodu v přenositelnosti a jednotnosti napříč platformami, ale trpí nízkým výkonem kvůli nutnosti kopírovat data z uživatelského prostoru do jádra a zpět. V posledních několika letech vývojáři pracují na jaderném ovladači OVPN, který umožňuje zpracování dat provádět přímo v rámci jádra.
articles.title: Ovladač OpenVPN pro linuxové jádro zvyšuje výkon

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Manjaro 24.1 „Xahea“, aktuální sestavení rolující distribuce Manjaro, je venku. Jde o nové instalační obrazy od května, přinášející jak jádro řady Linux 6.10, tak aktualizované verze tří základních desktopů, dle vkusu uživatele.
articles.title: Manjaro 24.1 nabízí Linux 6.10 a k tomu GNOME 46, KDE Plasma 6.1 a Xfce 4.18

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Vývojáři desktopového prostředí Xfce upřesnili roadmapu příští verze 4.20. Ta by se měla objevit ještě před Vánoci tohoto roku, konkrétně 15. prosince. O dva týdny později, pokud by byla potřeba vydat třetí vývojové vydání.
articles.title: Xfce 4.20 možná už v prosinci

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na serveru Root.cz funguje podporovatelský program skoro deset let. Fanouškům, kteří naší činnost takto podporují, děkujeme. Nyní mají stejnou šanci i čtenáři našeho sesterského webu Lupa.cz.
articles.title: Lupa.cz spustila podporovatelský program po vzoru sesterského serveru Root.cz

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vyšla beta verze Thunderbirdu pro Android a vývojáři prosí uživatele, aby ji pomohli otestovat. Beta testování nám pomáhá najít kritické chyby a hrubé hrany, které můžeme v následujících týdnech vypilovat, píší lidé z Mozilly na blogu. Stahovat můžete na Google Play nebo vývojářské verze na GitHubu.
articles.title: Mozilla uvolnila beta verzi Thunderbirdu pro Android

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Čerstvě vydaný FFmpeg 7.1 přináší plně nativní dekodér VVC akcelerovaný technologií Intel QSV, nový dekodér MV-HEVC, nový dekodér LC-EVC, nový dekodér xHE-AAC, filtr LCEVC, hardwarové kodéry Vulkan H.264 a H.265 a kodér D3D12VA HEVC.
articles.title: FFmpeg 7.1 se stabilním dekodérem VVC a kodérem Vulkan H.264/H.265

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejnerů a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 14. a 15. října. Školení proběhne pouze online.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Nintendo zřejmě nakonec vyhrála svůj boj o vyřazení nejoblíbenějších emulátorů Nintendo Switch pro PC. V březnu společnost zažalovala vývojáře emulátoru Yuzu a nyní přesvědčilo i hlavního vývojáře emulátoru Ryujinx, aby odešel.
articles.title: Společnost Nintendo ukončila vývoj emulátoru Ryujinx

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili novou verzi prohlížeče Firefox s označením 131. Umožňuje udělení dočasných oprávnění webovým stránkám, přičemž tato oprávnění mají platnost po dobu jedné hodiny nebo do zavření karty.
articles.title: Firefox 131 nabízí dočasná oprávnění pro weby a ukazuje náhledy panelů

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: bkralik)
articles.description: Léto skončilo, ochladilo se a naplno se začal projevovat podzim. Ovšem z nebe nepadá jen listí, po dlouhém váhání na nás z vesmíru spadl i Boeing Starliner, o čemž se určitě na této Virtuální Bastlírně leccos dozvíte. Strahovákům spadlo však do klína mnohem více událostí - Raspberry Pi Pico 2 je nyní již dostupné, vyšel firmware ve verzi 1.0 pro Flipper Zero, na trhu se objevila AI kamera s akcelerátorem pro Raspberry Pi 5, ale také se objevily první záběry zbytků ponorky Oceangate Titanic a začaly probíhat analýzy příčin jejího selhání. Kromě takto žhavých novinek jsou tu ale i zajímavá témata ze světa hardwaru!
articles.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 43: podzim, ponorky a rakety

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Uživatelé notebooků s velkým GPU Nvidia, kteří by rádi používali výstup z GeForce skrze konektory připojené k primárnímu iGPU Intel a připojující LCD monitor, mohou s Ubuntu 24.10 být konečně spokojení. Tzv. „Reverse PRIME“ nyní na Ubuntu, které vyjde za několik dnů, funguje.
articles.title: Reverse PRIME na Ubuntu 24.10 bez potíží

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Phoronix otestoval výkon nejnovějších mobilních CPU rodiny Intel Lunar Lake co do grafického výkonu. Pro tuto chvíli a pro Linux zatím platí, že výkon není lepší než u předchozí generace Meteor Lake, procesor jej však podává při nižší spotřebě.
articles.title: Výkon iGPU Intel Lunar Lake Xe2 je na Linuxu prozatím zklamáním

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Že lze Doom engine portovat prakticky na cokoli, to už víme. Ostatně běží na zubních kartáčcích či těhotenských testech, takže udivit by neměl ani nejnovější počin vývojáře Josepha Hubera, který Doom rozběhal na GPU, téměř bez využití CPU.
articles.title: Doom portován na GPU, běží přes AMD ROCm + LLVM libc

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Raspberry Pi dnes uvedlo svoji AI kameru se Sony IMX500, který kombinuje 12,3 MPx snímač s AI akcelerátorem pro inferenci. Ten zpracovává data ve formátu Int8 a měl by být schopen vyhodnocovat až 30 FPS. Má 8 MB RAM, kde se ukládá firmware a AI model. Sony využívá AI framework TensorFlow Lite. V kameře je předinstalovaný AI model MobileNet SSD pro rozpoznávání objektů. Případně lze použít PoseNet na detekování pozice.
articles.title: Raspberry Pi AI kamera

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Nový výzkum ETH Curych dokáže správně vyřešit 100 % úloh reCAPTCHA v2. Dřívější modely měly úspěšnost 68–71 %. Použit je open source model YOLO v8 (You Only Look Once).
articles.title: AI vyřeší 100 % reCAPTCHA v2

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Na internetu píšou, že začít s automatizací správy serverů můžete do půl hodiny. Dokážeme vám, že s Ansible to je pravda. Stačí navštívit naše pražské školení Ansible – úvod do automatizace a pak navazující Ansible – role a AWX.
articles.title: Ansible: úvod do automatizace, role a AWX (školení)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: V roce 2019 vyšlo najevo, že společnost Meta od roku 2012 uchovávala hesla některých uživatelů Facebooku a Instagramu v plaintextu. Týkalo se to hlavně uživatelů mobilní aplikace Facebook Lite (stovky miliónů), některých uživatelů Facebooku (desítky miliónů) a Instagramu (desítky tisíc).
articles.title: Meta zaplatí pokutu 91 milónů eur za hesla v plaintextu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description:
Java 23 predstavila možnosť importu modulov. Java organizuje kód do balíčkov, ktoré je potom možné spájať do modulov. Tieto moduly môžeme najnovšie tiež importovať pomocou import príkazu.
Novinku popisuje dokument JEP 476: Module Import Declarations (Preview).
articles.title: Import modulov v Jave

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: HP v úterý představilo AI pomocníka při tisku s názvem Perfect Output. Jde o automatickou úpravu tištěných tabulek nebo webových stránek, které se typicky velmi špatně tisknou.
articles.title: HP představilo AI pomocníka při tisku

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Když se podíváte na takové ceny, nemůže vám uniknout velký rozdíl mezi nimi a po přístupu na oficiální kanály. Například v případě Windows 11 Pro je srovnání cen mezi €20 a €259 naprosto senzační.
articles.title: Windows 10 jen za €14, Windows 11 za €20 v podzimním výprodeji na Goodoffer24

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Konica Minolta naučila kamery vidět dovnitř výrobků. Dokážou rozpoznat správné složení léků či potravin. Konsorcium LUMI-Q podepsalo smlouvu o zřízení kvantového počítače v ČR. Každý třetí útok ransomwaru na české firmy začíná zneužitím zranitelnosti. Přínosy AI v podnikových informačních systémech. Huawei Connect 2024: Chceme budovat infrastrukturu, která obstojí v budoucnosti. Laser změní izolant na polovodič.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Konsorcium LUMI-Q podepsalo smlouvu o zřízení kvantového počítače v ČR

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 39/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Golden: ve 2D se konečně podařilo připravit i zlato. Temná hmota mohla pomoci vytvořit supermasivní černé díry v raném vesmíru. Pozitronium ochladili téměř na absolutní nulu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Konsorcium LUMI-Q podepsalo smlouvu o zřízení kvantového počítače v ČR

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Salesforce představuje Agentforce – AI nástroj pro budoucnost zákaznických služeb. Novinky v MSP platformě Acronis: Copilot a automatizované postupy odezvy. Třetina firem v ČR má téměř nulovou míru digitalizace. Objevili nový materiál pro opticky řízenou magnetickou paměť.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Třetina firem v ČR má téměř nulovou míru digitalizace

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 38/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Supravodivost: Popsali bohatý svět hydridů yttria. Supravodič zesílený magnetismem. Pro supravodivost hydridů by mohl být klíčový také cer. Dnešní podobu Sluneční soustavy mohla zformovat další hvězda.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Podařilo se vytvořit otisk zrcadel do superfotonu

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Když vidíte podobné ceny, při srovnání nákupu softwaru na oficiálních kanálech s Goodoffer24 se při tak velkém rozdílu nemůžete splést. Například u Windows 11 Pro je srovnání naprosto úžasné, protože srovnáváte částku €20 s tradiční cenou €259.
articles.title: Oficiální cena Windows 11 Pro je €259 avšak Goodoffer24 účtuje jen €20

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Chytré kamery umí předejít útokům se zbraní. Útočníka odhalí i v davu. Umělá inteligence pohání rostoucí investice do cloudových služeb PaaS a IaaS. Platforma RHEL AI podpoří podnikové inovace. AI patří i na notebooky. Bezserverová architektura není všelékem.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Bezserverová architektura není všelékem

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 37/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Zmapovali 50 000 záhadných uzlů DNA v lidském genomu. Kolik tak mohly vážit první hvězdy? Kabely pro jaderné elektrárny budou bezpečnější a vydrží déle.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Má smysl namísto života hledat ve vesmíru složitou chemii?

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 1.50.0 sady nástrojů pro správu síťových připojení NetworkManager. Novinkám se v příspěvku na blogu NetworkManageru věnuje Fernando F. Mancera. Vypíchnout lze podporu nastavení veth (virtual ethernet) v nmtui.
articles.title: NetworkManager 1.50.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána nová verze 24.1 linuxové distribuce Manjaro (Wikipedie). Její kódové jméno je Xahea. Ke stažení je v edicích GNOME, KDE PLASMA a XFCE.
articles.title: Manjaro 24.1 Xahea

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Mobilní Datovka, tj. svobodná aplikace pro přístup k datovým schránkám pro zařízení s operačním systémem iOS a Android, byla vydána v nové verzi 2.1.0. Nově je pro sestavení potřeba Qt 6.7.
articles.title: Mobilní Datovka 2.1.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Přesně před 35 lety, 3. října 1989, byla vydána počítačová hra Prince of Persia. Jejím tvůrcem je Jordan Mechner.
articles.title: Počítačová hra Prince of Persia slaví 35 let

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost PINE64 stojící za telefony PinePhone nebo notebooky Pinebook publikovala na svém blogu zářijový souhrn novinek. Po půl roce od předchozího. Vypíchnout lze nové desky StarPro64, Oz64 a Quartz64-Zero.
articles.title: Novinky od PINE64 - 09/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla zveřejněna ePetice Výzva za strategický přístup k digitalizaci: Kvalita, flexibilita a udržitelnost ve státních projektech.
articles.title: Výzva za strategický přístup k digitalizaci: Kvalita, flexibilita a udržitelnost ve státních projektech

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Japonský Google rozšířil svou kolekci DYI fyzických klávesnic Gboard o klávesnici ve tvaru Möbiovy pásky. Pro zájemce repozitář na GitHubu.
articles.title: Klávesnice ve tvaru Möbiovy pásky

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Nintendo zařízla projekt Ryujinx (Wikipedie), tj. open source emulátor herní konzole Nintendo Switch. Odstraněna byla stránka ke stažení i repozitář na GitHubu.
articles.title: Nintendo zařízlo open source emulátor Ryujinx

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byla vydána beta verze Thunderbirdu pro Android. Ostrá verze by měla vyjít ke konci října. Thunderbird pro Android vznikl z K-9 Mailu.
articles.title: Thunderbird pro Android - Beta

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán Mozilla Firefox 131.0. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání, poznámkách k vydání pro firmy a na stránce věnované vývojářům. Řešeny jsou rovněž bezpečnostní chyby. Nový Firefox 131 je již k dispozici také na Flathubu a Snapcraftu.
articles.title: Firefox 131.0

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Google engineers have been working on support for the Linux kernel to leverage AutoFDO feedback directed optimizations and Propeller optimizations when compiling the Linux kernel with LLVM/Clang. In turn this can help Linux systems see 2~10% better performance thanks to the more optimized kernel...
articles.title: Google Updates Patches For AutoFDO+Propeller Optimized Linux Kernel

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: After years of AmpereComputing talking about AmpereOne AArch64 server processors, it looks like we are finally on the cusp of seeing broader availability of the processors and servers/motherboards for this ARM server platform up to 192 cores. At the end of August I finally received a temporary review system with the AmpereOne A192-32X flagship SKU. That server was the Supermicro ARS-211M-NR and is supposed to be seeing availability real soon. Now the latest on the AmpereOne front is Giga Computing (Gigabyte) announcing general availability of their servers...
articles.title: Giga Computing Announces GA On Their AmpereOne Servers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: NetworkManager 1.50 released on Wednesday as the newest version of this software commonly used on the Linux desktop for managing wired and wireless network connections...
articles.title: NetworkManager 1.50 Released - Now Ensures Offensive Terms Don't Appear In Settings

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Unified Acceleration Foundation (UXL Foundation), which was formed out of Intel's oneAPI software efforts, will be hosting a virtual developer summit...
articles.title: UXL Foundation Hosting Virtual oneAPI DevSummit 2024 Next Week

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Steam's Remote Play feature that allows playing Steam games on phones / tablets / TVs / other PCs while streamed from your main gaming system now is able to handle AV1 video streaming...
articles.title: Steam Remote Play Adds AV1 Video Streaming Support Plus More Linux Fixes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: If you have been trying out Linux 6.12-rc1 or a recent Linux Git snapshot and discovered your laptop's touchpad is no longer working, you are far from alone. The good news is the issue has been quickly tracked down and has led to a new input driver being reverted...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 Drops New Driver That Ended Up Breaking Laptop Touchpad Support For Many Users

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the recent Intel layoffs and early retirement / buyout packages, I have been curious to see what impact it will have on the open-source/Linux software engineers at the company. There's at least a few driver maintainers that have unfortunately departed the company but at least no major exodus of their well respected Linux software engineers...
articles.title: Some Intel Linux Driver Maintainers Have Left The Company

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Redox OS open-source Rust-written operating system project has published their September 2024 status update...
articles.title: Redox OS Making Progress On RISC-V Support, Eyes QEMU & Neovim Ports

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the Intel Xeon 6900P "Granite Rapids" processors that launched last week there are SNC3 and HEX clustering modes for these new processors. The default Sub-NUMA Clustering 3 (SNC3) mode for the three compute dies while the HEX mode is like SNC1 mode formerly for all three compute dies acting as one NUMA node. Using the flagship 128-core Intel Xeon 6980P processors, I ran some benchmarks looking at the real-world performance difference for SNC3 vs. HEX clustering modes on Granite Rapids.
articles.title: Intel Xeon 6980P SNC3 vs. HEX Clustering Mode Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: A roadmap/schedule has been published for the lightweight Xfce 4.20 desktop. If all goes well this next iteration of the Xfce desktop will be out before Christmas...
articles.title: Xfce 4.20 Aiming For Release In December

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For those wanting to build really nifty and complex text user interfaces (TUIs) for terminal applications, Notcurses is one of the options for maximizing the "terminal bling" with some rather vibrant features that goes well beyond what's offered with the likes of Ncurses. It's been nearly two years since the last release while was surprised today to see out a new version...
articles.title: Notcurses Is Still Alive For Ramping Up "Terminal Bling" With Complex TUIs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Linux 6.11 kernel introduced getrandom() in the vDSO for faster yet secure user-space random number generation needs. In addition to patches pending for Glibc to make use of getrandom() vDSO support, Golang is now another early user of this functionality...
articles.title: Golang Now Enables Speedier getrandom() On Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For those making use of OpenVPN for your virtual private network (VPN) needs, years in the making has been an "OVPN" Linux kernel driver to enhance the performance by offloading more of the work to kernel-space...
articles.title: OpenVPN Kernel Driver Patches Updated For Improving VPN Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Manjaro 24.1 "Xahea" debuted on Tuesday as the newest update to this Arch Linux based distribution. Manjaro 24.1 is the first new tagged release since May and with it comes updated desktop options, the Linux 6.10 kernel, and other package upgrades...
articles.title: Manjaro 24.1 Released With GNOME 46, KDE Plasma 6.1 & Xfce 4.18 Desktop Options

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in May Steam on Linux usage crossed the 2% threshold and remained that way until August when it dropped back below 2% for all Steam gamers. The September 2024 Steam Survey results were just published and point to another downward bump for Steam on Linux gaming...
articles.title: Steam On Linux Percentage Receded A Bit Further In September

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Python 3.13 had been scheduled for release today with a new interactive interpreter, experimental free-threaded build mode to disable the Global Interpreter Lock (GIL), an experimental JIT, and other shiny new features. But a performance regression has delayed the Python 3.13 release to next week and in turn an unexpected Python 3.13-rc3 final test release...
articles.title: Python 3.13 Sees Last Minute Delay Due To Performance Regression

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel is preparing a new staging feature for better handling of CPU microcode updates. Initial patches for the Linux kernel are out for discussion in enabling this feature that can yield around a 40% reduction in latency during the CPU microcode updating process...
articles.title: Intel Preparing New "Staging" Feature For Better Handling CPU Microcode Updates

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Taking place last week in Paris was the annual Kernel Recipes conference devoted to a variety of Linux topics and sponsored by Meta, Dell, Arm, AMD, and other organizations. The slides and videos from the different Linux/open-source talks are now online for those wanting to watch some interesting technical content...
articles.title: Kernel Recipes 2024 Slides & Videos Posted

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: One of the interesting highlights of September was finally having our hands on an AmpereOne server! After years of being eager to test Ampere Computing's next-generation AArch64 server processors, Ampere sent over their 192-core flagship server processor for a few weeks of testing. The review server was comprised of the AmpereOne A192-32X flagship model within a Supermicro ARS-211M-NR 2U server.
articles.title: Supermicro ARS-211M-NR AmpereOne Server With R13SPD Motherboard

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off last year's release of the EPYC 8004 "Siena" processors featuring up to sixty-four Zen 4C cores, AMD today announced the EPYC Embedded 8004 series...
articles.title: AMD Announces EPYC Embedded 8004 Series

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Firefox 131 is out today with a few improvements worth mentioning for Mozilla's web browser...
articles.title: Firefox 131 Released With Tab Preview & CHIPS Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: For those making use of "reverse PRIME" setups where you have a primary NVIDIA discrete GPU while monitors are connected to Intel integrated graphics as the secondary GPU, such configurations should be working nicely with the upcoming Ubuntu 24.10 release under Wayland. This support is also likely to be back-ported for Ubuntu 24.04 LTS...
articles.title: Reverse PRIME Now Works Nicely On Ubuntu 24.10

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While the Linux 6.12 merge window only ended this weekend and won't be out until November, already code is beginning to accumulate for DRM-Next of graphics driver improvements targeting the Linux 6.13 cycle that in turn will be the first major Linux kernel release of 2025. A nice improvement is on the way for the Raspberry Pi graphics driver...
articles.title: Linux 6.13 To Bring Big/Super Pages For The Raspberry Pi Graphics Driver - Better Performance

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Igalia open-source developer Carlos Garcia Campos has written a new blog post to outline recent graphics improvements found in WebKitGTK 2.46 and WPEWebKit 2.46. Most notable with the new stable release is using the Skia library rather than Cairo as the 2D graphics renderer. There are also other graphics improvements and more enhancements to come...
articles.title: WebKitGTK 2.46 Uses Skia Rather Than Cairo, More CPU/GPU Optimizations To Come

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: During the month of September on Phoronix there were 265 original news articles and 16 Linux hardware reviews / featured benchmark articles. Here's a look back at the most exciting content for September...
articles.title: Granite Rapids, AmpereOne & PREEMPT_RT Landing Made For An Exciting September

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Open-source developer Zeeshan Ali Khan presented at last week's systemd "All Systems Go" developer conference on busd as a new D-Bus broker written in the Rust programming language...
articles.title: Busd Taking Shape As A D-Bus Broker Written In Rust

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Linux Mint project has published their status update for September 2024 that outlines work on this desktop-focused, Ubuntu-derived Linux distribution as well as its in-house Cinnamon desktop environment...
articles.title: Cinnamon Pursuing Visual Improvements, Linux Mint Continues Working On Aptkit

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: An open-source developer at AMD has carried out a DOOM port that runs almost entirely atop AMD GPUs for rendering and the game logic. This DOOM GPU port relies on the AMD ROCm library with the LLVM libc C library for offloading the classic DOOM to the AMD GPU...
articles.title: DOOM Ported To Run Atop AMD ROCm + LLVM libc

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While I have been very eager to test out the Core Ultra 200V Lunar Lake series on Linux in part due to the new Xe2 integrated graphics, after several days of pushing a new Lunar Lake laptop on Linux the results have been very disappointing. Besides needing a very leading-edge software stack to enjoy the Xe2 accelerated graphics out-of-the-box, the performance currently is poor. It's a fraction of the Windows performance and currently falls behind the Meteor Lake graphics performance and in turn also being well behind the AMD RDNA3.5 competition with the Ryzen AI 300 series laptops.
articles.title: Intel Xe2 Lunar Lake Graphics Performance Disappoints On Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The newly-merged sched_ext allows for the Linux kernel scheduler to be made more extensible by allowing BPF programs to be loaded to affect the kernel's scheduling behavior. There's now a similar take on CPU frequency scaling: cpufreq_ext. There's a "request for comments" patch series on cpufreq_ext for making extensible CPU frequency scaling algorithm adaptations with BPF...
articles.title: Cpufreq_ext Being Worked On For BPF-Based CPU Frequency Scaling

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the third quarter drawing to a close, here's a look back at the most popular Linux/open-source related content for the quarter. This quarter there's been more than 730 news articles and 50 Linux hardware reviews / featured benchmark articles all written by your's truly covering a range of areas...
articles.title: AMD Ryzen 9000 Series Excited Linux Users The Most In Q3

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: FFmpeg 7.1 is out today as the newest update to this widely-used open-source multimedia library. With FFmpeg 7.1 the VVC video decoder has been promoted to stable, there are a number of Vulkan Video improvements, and an assortment of other exciting enhancements...
articles.title: FFmpeg 7.1 Released With VVC Decoder Promoted To Stable, Vulkan H.264/H.265 Encode

UK Coal
Beamsplitters
Late Cenozoic

articles.author: Nebojsa Prijic
articles.description:
Your sorcerer can become stronger if you sacrifice everything dear to you (in-game). Saying goodbye to Cursed Energy and all the powers it brings is a tough decision, but the reward is significant. Here's how to get Heavenly Restriction in Sorcery.


Table of Contents
Heavenly Restriction Sorcery Guide

How to Get True War Remnant
How to Enter the Void (Location)
How to Unlock Heavenly Restriction
How to Avoid Losing Items After Heavenly Restriction Wipe
All Physical Prowess Moves List - Heavenly Restriction Skill Tree

Heavenly Restriction Sorcery Guide


Screenshot via Tako YouTube


You must meet several requirements to unlock Heavenly Restriction, each requiring time, skill, and luck. Luckily, all can be done simultaneously while you…
articles.title: How to Get Heavenly Restriction in Sorcery Roblox

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The nominees for the next Premier League POTM SBC in EA FC 25 have been officially revealed by EA Sports, and you can now vote for your favorite star to get him a unique card in Ultimate Team.


Eight nominees have been chosen based on their Premier League performances in September. The winner will be decided by the votes cast by fans. Whoever wins the award will be honored with a special card, and everyone will have equal chances of completing the challenge. Without further ado, let's take a look at all eight nominees and how you can cast your vote.


All EA FC 25 Premier League POTM SBC nominees (October 2024)


Several stars shone in the league with their performances. While some of these players did their best in front of the goal, others contributed to the defensive side of things.


…

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
The servers for Throne and Liberty are down as of writing as the developers prepare the client for Update 1.1.0.


This is the first major post-launch update, and it's available on PC and consoles. While the update is already available across all platforms, the servers continue to be out of order. Thankfully, NCSoft has already informed a potential timeline regarding when you'll be able to play once again.


When will the Throne and Liberty servers go live after Update 1.1.0?


The maintenance began as scheduled at 12:30 a.m. PT/3:30 a.m. ET/7:30 a.m. UTC. According to the official notice, it is expected to last approximately six hours. If we assume that NCSoft will stick with that timeline, you can jump into Throne and Liberty at 6:30 a.m. PT/9:30 a.m. ET/1:30 p.m. UTC.




There's a chance that the maintenance could be extended at short notice. We have seen that happening in the past with games like Lost Ark, so a delay can't be ruled out yet. If there are no such delays, you should be able to play the latest MMO in about four hours since this article went live. If there are any delays, we will update the new timeline in this article.


The latest update includes some major changes across all platforms, much of which are targeted towards making the game a lot more stable. If the changes work as intended, the UI should feel smoother, and some of the errors you might have encountered till now should be resolved.


However, to test it out, we will have to wait at least a few more hours until NCSoft is done with its maintenance work.

The post Throne and Liberty Update 1.1.0 maintenance: When will the servers be back? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Throne and Liberty Update 1.1.0 maintenance: When will the servers be back?

articles.author: Arka Sarkar
articles.description:
If you're not playing with your friends and other players in Throne and Liberty, then what are you even doing!


A core experience of every MMO is to get together in adventures and share all the spoils. In Amazon Games' latest adventure, you can play with and against each other. The PvP scene is pretty near despite the early days, but you can simply concentrate on the PvE side of things. It's pretty fun to get together with your buddies to take down the strong bosses, and unlock unique rewards. To ease the process, you can either join a guild, or create one of your own.


How to create a guild in Throne and Liberty


While the easier job is just to join a guild, you can create one on your own as well.



Go to the main menu.


Select the Guild option.


Click on Create a Guild.


Choose your Guild Emblem, and you can also customize its looks.


Choose the name for your guild.


Once created, players can search for it and request to join. You can also share the details with your friends so that they can join.



Do note that you can't immediately create a guild after starting the game. You'll have to reach level 7 in order to make one (or join a guild).


How to join a guild in Throne and Liberty


If you don't want to create a guild, you can simply join one made by another player. As an alternative, you can also join a Party if you simply want to clear content, which is hard to do alone. Once you're level 7 or higher, go to the main menu.



Select the Guild function.


You can filter out your results using the available prerequisites.


Once you've found a guild, send a request to join.


Once your request is accepted, you'll be part of the guild.



Apart from joining guilds and parties, Throne and Liberty also has a matchmaking system for certain types of content. To access this feature, you'll need to reach player level 20.

The post How to create or join a guild in Throne and Liberty appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to create or join a guild in Throne and Liberty

articles.author: Matt Jackson
articles.description:
Dungeons & Dragons has enjoyed a significant renaissance in recent years thanks to its appearance on Stranger Things, as well as the increasing popularity of YouTube channels like Critical Role. However, according to some experts, its resurgence might not be entirely down to its appearance in popular culture. Counselors and psychologists report that the game can help to develop learning skills while also enabling players to improve social skills and even work through cognitive problems.


There are examples of mental health professionals using the TTRPG to help treat patients. One child anxiety counselor in North Carolina offers D&D therapy sessions and in one blog post, Katie Lear highlights how it can help with self-esteem, self-confidence, and social skills while also encouraging partic…
articles.title: D&D shown to improve social, problem-solving, and learning skills, according to study

articles.author: Daniel Morris
articles.description:
South Korean publisher Krafton has confirmed that it signed a licensing agreement with Palworld developer, Pocketpair. The agreement will see PUBG: Battlegrounds developer, PUBG Studios, bring Palworld to mobile devices for the first time.


Touted as "Pokemon with guns" by fans, Palworld was a surprise gargantuan success upon its Early Access launch earlier this year. Few, least of all Pocketpair, could have seen its eyewatering sales figures coming, as it stormed to the top of the charts on PC and Xbox consoles at the start of 2024.


Image via Pocketpair


Player counts have dropped in the months since, although a recent PlayStation 5 release has helped bring new fans into the fold. Nintendo and The Pokemon Company suing Pocketpair has also played a part in keeping Palworld in the news cycle of late.


Krafton confirmed Palworld's upcoming mobile port in a statement on its website, with its subsidiary PUBG Studios moving forward on the project. The announcement gave no release window for Palworld on Android and iOS, although it did confirm it "plans to faithfully reinterpret and implement the original’s main fun elements to fit the mobile environment." Whether this results in any significant gameplay changes remains to be seen.

The post PUBG developer is bringing Palworld to mobile appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: PUBG developer is bringing Palworld to mobile

Wizards of the Coast now has complete control over their card game's most popular format. Some might be surprised to learn that Magic: The Gathering's most popular and beloved format, Commander, was not already overseen by the card game's owners. The answer, in short, is that the format wasn't for Wizards. Commander is for everyone. 


Commander was born from Elder Dragon Highlander (EDH) format on an air force base in Alaska. A Magic Judge named Sheldon Menery started to shape this format in the early 2000s around the idea of a social, player-driven philosophy. Sheldon founded the Commander Rules Committee (RC) to help guide the format down these hopeful paths. The intention of the RC has always been to encourage the social, casual nature of Commander, rather than enforce strict rulesets.…

articles.author: Franklin Bellone Borges
articles.description:
No matter if you are playing on consoles or PC, nothing will be more handy in Throne and Liberty than the ability to auto run, as doing it will allow you to take a break while still making your way to your destination. 


But how exactly can you do that in the game? Here's how to auto run in Throne and Liberty, no matter your platform of choice.


How to Auto Run in Throne and Liberty on both consoles and PC


You can auto run in Throne and Liberty when playing with a controller by opening your Quick Menu —hold L2/LT— and then selecting Move Constantly. PC players using a mouse and keyboard can also trigger the action by simply pressing "/". You can also set a keybind to the action on consoles, as well as change the default one on PC by doing the following: 



How to change your auto run keybind on PC

Head to Settings


Go to Shotcuts and then to Character


Scroll down until you spot Move Constantly


Click to reassign your keybind. 






How to assign an auto run shortcut on consoles (PS5 and Xbox)

Head to Settings


Open the Controller tab and then select Custom under Presets.


Scroll down until you spot Move Constantly.


Assign your desired input/input combination to the action. 





Image by Destructoid


Keep in mind that once auto running, you will be able to direct your character by moving your camera, as well as cancel the action by either performing a movement input or interacting with anything. To make sure you will be able to sharp turns, I recommend adjusting your Camera Sensitively, a feat you can do by heading to Gameplay and then to Camera. 


Now that you know how to make your travels a little easier, don't forget to also check out how to get the Rare Lithograph in Throne and Liberty.

The post How to Auto Run in Throne and Liberty appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to Auto Run in Throne and Liberty

articles.author: Steven Mills
articles.description:
11 bit studios revealed today that the sci-fi survival sim has been delayed from its 2024 release window to Q1 2025. According to the team, The Alters needs the extra time to optimize and ensure every aspect of the player's journey as as seamless as possible.




I played through the demo of The Alters in the previous Steam Next Fest and while I enjoy pretty much everything 11 bit creates, The Alters felt special. In fact, it was my favorite demo of the fest and put The Alters up there with my most highly anticipated releases of the year. 


You take on the role of Jan Dolski, a space miner who crash lands on a harsh distant planet that is so close to its sun that sunrise on this planet means lethal doses of radiation. But Jan finds a strange resource on the planet called Rapidium that allows him to create alternate versions of himself called Alters.


Each version of Jan appears to have lived its own life a different way; one Jan may be a scientist, while another is a doctor. Using these many Jans, the player must create outposts across the planet to gather resources and continue to survive and tech up. But each Jan also has its own emotions and needs. The result makes The Alters part base builder and part The Sims-like management of your Alters. Like 11 bit studios' other series Frostpunk, The Alters is pretty narrative-driven as you progress.


I'm all for a brief delay to get a title some extra love as it enters its final stretch, and I'll for sure be picking up The Alters. But I hope others are willing to give it a shot in what is turning out to be a pretty jam-packed Q1 2025 with some big releases like Civilization 7, Assassin's Creed Shadows, Monster Hunter Wilds, and more.


The Alters is now set to release in Q1 2025 on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S.

The post Sci-fi survival sim The Alters delayed to Q1 2025 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Sci-fi survival sim The Alters delayed to Q1 2025

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
articles.description:
The RIAA and MPA are concerned about a recent court ruling that could hinder their ability to combat online piracy using DMCA subpoenas. The court's decision suggests that IP addresses may not be considered "links", potentially limiting the scope of these subpoenas. This interpretation could impact the music and film industries' efforts to identify and take action against infringers and operators of piracy services.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: RIAA and MPA Urge Court Not to Disarm the DMCA Subpoena Anti-Piracy Tool

Other service providers, including ISPs, will face prison for failing to report "known" criminal conduct. A vote on the text is scheduled for today and the new legislation could be in place in less than a week.
From: TF, for the latest news on copyright battles, piracy and more.
articles.title: Italy Approves Piracy Shield VPN/DNS Proposal, Risk of Prison For ISPs Intact [Updated]

articles.author: Ernesto Van der Sar
